standard_metadata.standard_description: Express a fraction with denominator 10 as an equivalent fraction with denominator 100, and use this technique to add two fractions with respective denominators 10 and 100.

question.content: **Complete the equation to make an equivalent fraction.**  $\dfrac8{10}=\dfrac{t}{100}$  ${t}=$

images.alt: Two squares, one square divided into ten equal-sized rows with the bottom 8 rows shaded blue.
A second square is divided into 10 equal-size rows, each made up of 10 equal-size squares. No squares are shaded.  An equal sign separates the two squares.

hints.content: Equivalent fractions have the same area shaded.    How many $\text{\greenD{hundredths}}$ should we shade to cover the same area as $\blueD{\dfrac8{10}}?$

images.alt: Two squares, one square divided into ten equal-sized rows with the bottom 8 rows shaded.

A second square is divided into 10 equal-size rows, each made up of 10 equal-size squares. All squares in the bottom 8 rows are shaded. An equal sign separates the two squares. Each square has the same area shaded.
